AGE-OLD.Definition: very old, existing for a long time

OUTCROPS.Definition: rock formations that are visible on the surface

STUBBORN.Definition: not willing to change or listen to others

STATUS-SEEKING.Definition: trying to look important or powerful

SUPERIOR.Definition: better or more powerful than others

BUFFER ZONE.Definition: a space between the two areas to keep peace

RELIC.Definition: something old from the past, remains

SETTLERS.Definition: people who moved to the place to live

BRUTALLY.Definition: in a very cruel or violent way

BROADER.Definition: more general or covering more things

RESISTING.Definition: fighting against or refusing to accept

UNORTHODOX.Definition: not normal or not following usual rules

BASE.Definition: a place used as a centre of operations by the armed forces or others

ON PAPER.Definition: in theory but not necessarily in reality

SULTAN.Definition: a king or ruler in some muslim countries

NOMINAL.Definition: existing in name only, not real or powerful

ROOTS.Definition: the place or culture where they come from

BUBBLED.Definition: slowly grew or increased almost ready to burst

CURFEWS.Definition: regulations requiring people to remain indoors between specified hours, typically at night

MILITIAS.Definition: groups of fighters who were not part of a regular army

PARTITION.Definition: the act of dividing it into parts

CROWN COLONY.Definition: a country ruled by the British government

REASSESSING.Definition: thinking about it again to make a new decision

BURDEN.Definition: something difficult or heavy to deal with

VETO.Definition: the power to stop a decision

COMPROMISE.Definition: the action of giving up something to reach an agreement

TICKING TIME BOMB.Definition: a situation that could suddenly become dangerous

JUNTA.Definition: a group of military leaders who ruled the country after taking power

COUP.Definition: a sudden and forceful takeover of power

DISPLACING.Definition: forcing them to leave their homes

LEGITIMACY.Definition: being legal or accepted as right

PRECARIOUS.Definition: not safe or likely to fall apart

SIGNATORY.Definition: a country that has signed the agreement

DISPUTED.Definition: argued about or not agreed on

STANDOFF.Definition: a situation where the two sides could not agree or move forward

STOOD ITS GROUND.Definition: refused to move back or change position

COMMON GROUND.Definition: something both sides can agree on
